instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4: What is PM_SLP_S4? This is a typo of PM_SLP_S4_L When you see PM_SLP_S4, assume they meant to type PM_SLP_S4_L.
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .
definitions.5V_S0: What is 5V_S0? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S0”.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP_BUS_G3H: What is PP_BUS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PP_BUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light, fan twitch, no power
threads.message:
Hey all,

Hope all is well. I need some help with a 3330 that's killing me. Has fan twitch and pulsing rails. <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> are steady. <SIGNAL>3V3_S3</SIGNAL> & <SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> are pulsing (so is <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4</SIGNAL> so I guess that makes sense). <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>5V_S0</SIGNAL> are not pulsing, they're at a steady 0.13v.

The other peculiar thing is that the battery sensor thing shows that my good battery is 90% charged up, but the charger won't change to an orange light. <SIGNAL>PP_BUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 12.6 with and WITHOUT the battery. However with just the battery (no magsafe) i get no signs of life at all, including no fan twitch.

I checked ISL and the common problems, resistance from 17/18 is 2.6, 27/28 is 20.1 ohms. Replaced ISL just in case, still the same symptom.

I don't have an 85w charger, so I've resorted to using a known good battery and charger.

I'm leaning towards a short on an s3 line, but that wouldn't explain the lack of orange light right?

Any help is appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no orange light, fan twitch, no power
threads.message:
Did you try known good DCIN board?

Board should start with 60W charger and battery plugged in (with some charge).
But seems that battery is not properly detceted by SMC.
In this case, you need 85W original charger for test!!!
Also try to start in SMC bypass mode.

Post voltages for <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01.
Also need resistance to ground on SCL/SDA lines for battery bus; diode mode, red to ground, no battery connected, nor charger!
